Name: Stela of Pa-bes
Description: Painted wooden stela divided into four registers, each surrounded by a polychrome triglyphic band. Underneath the lunette with the winged sun disc is a line of hieroglyphs. The third register depicts the adoration scene. The deceased is standing in front of an offering stand with offerings and a row of gods: Harakhty, Isis and the four sons of Horus. The stela ends with a three-line inscription. The stela is in a rather poor condition.
